title: Comparison of forces exerted by racket and ball

content.description: A 0.060 kg tennis ball moving at 15 m/s strikes a tennis racket and rebounds at 10 m/s in the opposite direction, as shown above. The ball is in contact with the racket for 0.030 s.
content.question: How does the magnitude of the average force exerted by the ball on the racket compare to the magnitude of the average force exerted by the racket on the ball?

choices.label: It cannot be determined without knowing the mass of the racket.
It cannot be determined without knowing the recoil speed of the racket.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
